fields.summary: Click on discard changes takes me to Page not Found
Confluence should've an option to clean everything up
"Add-on Templates" are displayed in Confluence and Space Admin, but cannot be used
Export of Confluence pages with Mathjax content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27993].
  {panel}

Currently, when one does {{confluence2.storePage}} call of page with a title that already exists, one would get this exception:
{code}
org.springframework.transaction.UnexpectedRollbackException: Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only
{code} 
As per [this KB|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/iYHbCg]:
bq. This is a result, not a cause. You must look at the stacktrace above this error in order to understand the root cause.

The complete stacktrace in the log looks like this:

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27944].
  {panel}

Heartbeat doesn't produce any output when there is an error connecting to the server (application service not available, network connection problem, etc..)

If there is a temporary server failure and the user has a valid authorization cookie (he checked the "remember me" option when logged in), the connection will be restored when the server is back up, and the user won't probably notice it.

If he hasn't, then successive heartbeat requests will keep failing without any warning (401 errors), with the risk of losing data when the user attempts to save the page.

Possible solutions:

- Warn the user when there is problem heartbeating so he knows and takes the appropriate measures.
- Save the current draft in localStorage, so we can recover it in the case of error when posting the page ([~cpetchell]'s idea)
fields.summary: Heartbeat doesn't output error when the connection to the server fails.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27923].
  {panel}

As of our docs here: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Database+Setup+For+MySQL

It says that the server level collation also has to be set, however as of the official MySQL docs (http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/charset-server.html) say:
_"The server character set and collation are used as default values if the database character set and collation are not specified in CREATE DATABASE statements. They have no other purpose."_

This came up in one ticket here: [https://support.atlassian.com/browse/FSH-10923?focusedCommentId=3264345&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-3264345].

I believe it is just easier to set the default collation for the whole server and not only set it on DB level, which would be sufficient for Confluence too as it is for JIRA.

Obviously this theory needs confirmation, this is why I did not edit the doc straight.
fields.summary: MySQL documentation for server collation/charset

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27907].
  {panel}

Hello Atlassians,

I'd really like to request an increment macro.  Here is an example in a table:

|increment|Apples|
|increment|Bananas|
|increment|Coconuts|

When the page is parsed, it would be shown as follows:

|1|Apples|
|2|Bananas|
|3|Coconuts|

In addition, you should be able put the increments in groups so you can have several on a page.

|{increment:group=fruit}|Apples|
|{increment:group=fruit}|Bananas|
|{increment:group=fruit}|Coconuts|
|{increment:group=veg}|Aubergines|
|{increment:group=veg}|Beans|
|{increment:group=veg}|Carrots|

Becomes

|1|Apples|
|2|Bananas|
|3|Coconuts|
|1|Aubergines|
|2|Beans|
|3|Carrots|

Also, specifying a unique ID for a counter would mean you can reference an increment instance.

{increment:group=list_of_presents} Teddy bear
{increment:group=list_of_presents:id=my_favourite_present} Optimus Prime
{increment:group=list_of_presents} Box of chocolates

You can now put:

"Please see present #{increment:value_of=my_favourite_present} which was my best ever!"

In addition, you'd be able to attach child-increments into parents and have decimal-based numbers like 1.4, 5.3.21 etc.


Thank you for your time.  Keep up the good work!  d:-)

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27894].
  {panel}

We would like an easy way to highlight any text on a page (individual words, characters, sentences, or paragraphs, standalone or within a table or header, etc.) with color through the WYSIWYG editor, applied as a formatting option much like Bold, Italic, or Underline are currently applied. An entire palette of colors isn't necessary, but even 2 or 3 options would be tremendously useful.

There are ways to highlight table rows and columns or individual cells, and through plugins there are ways to highlight individual words via the {highlight} macro. But this plugin/macro is not terribly efficient when trying highlight multiple, non-adjacent words.

The basis for this functionality may already exist, as email notifications and version comparisons show changes in highlighted text of different colors. 

Example of desired output is attached in "ExamplesOfHighlightedText.jpg".

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27878].
  {panel}

Hello,

i am currently testing the administration options of confluence and found a behaviour that i don't understand. As described in https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Global+Permissions+Overview, members of the confluence-administrators group can't see restricted pages in {children} macros. ("They cannot immediately see the pages that exclude them via page restrictions without knowing the direct URL to the page. ... For example, they will not see restricted pages displayed by the children macro. But they are able to access restricted pages directly using the page URL.")

I've tested this, and my members of confluence-administrators can see all pages (even pages that another user restriced to himself) - in the pagetree (Documentation Theme) and also in children macros .

As i understand the documentation, this shouldn't be possible. Can you reproduce this behavior?  

Best regards,
Sebastian Höhne

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27873].
  {panel}

Most Confluence OutOfMemory errors that we see in OnDemand are caused by attachment indexing, specifically PDF indexing and Office Connector (doc, xls, ppt) indexing.

These OOMs are problematic for a number of reasons:
- they are disruptive to the customer because it triggers the instance to be restarted (~5-10 mins downtime),
- they sometimes happen repeatedly in a loop, requiring manual intervention by Support/HOPS, and
- they result in Confluence's Xmx being raised (overall higher memory costs for the Unicorn platform).

I suspect fixing the attachment indexers is a tough problem. Instead, I propose that we simply disable these attachment indexer modules by default in OnDemand.

In my experience, OnDemand customers do not commonly use this functionality. If customers do want it, they can submit a Support request to have us enable it. This would provide good information on how much it's being used and how much an effect turning it off by default would improve overall Unicorn stability and memory usage.
fields.summary: Disable attachment indexing in OnDemand by default

e*Overview:*

1. Remove the need to upgrade to 3.5 when coming from 3.4 or earlier.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence+Manually

2. Reinforce the concept that "Upgrades between major versions only are necessary" (like in JIRA)
2.X --> 3.X --> 4.3.7 --> 5.0

*Detailed tasks:*

* {color:green}DONE:{color} Fix the mentions of 3.5 on this page:
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Upgrading+Confluence

** Fix the link on "release notes and upgrade guides" while we're at it.

* {color:green}DONE:{color} Check the 4.3.7 issues for other items that require docs. 
_Tues 29/1:_ Checked -- all bug fixes; no docs required.

If you enlarge an image and press back, the page changes but the image remains up (and the shrink effect makes the image disappear into the top left corner).

We should either...

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27845].
  {panel}

Currently, a page title is represented with an absolute url in mail notification for page edit and comment. For example: http://localhost:8099/display/TEST/new+again

So, when the page is moved to another space, the url/path has changed for example to http://localhost:8099/display/ds/new+again. When a user click on the page title link in the mail notification, he/she will be redirected to the old url and will be getting Page Not Found.

To improve this, we should make use of tiny url instead, like the one we used in shared page and mention mail notification. Here is the example:
!mail.png!
fields.summary: Replace absolute url with tiny url in mail notification of page edit and comment

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-27825].
  {panel}

*Atlassian edit*
If you use the insert JIRA Issue Macro to create an issue on a confluence page, it only takes the default required fields into account. If you have defined any other fields in your field configuration to be a required field, it will not show up in the macro. When trying to create the issue, the error message as described above will appear.

*Original report*

We have the following setup:
* Confluence 4.2.13
* Jira 5.2.2
* Greenhopper 6.1.0

Confluence and Jira are trusted applications.

When we try to create a new epic via the Jira-Issues-Macro we get the following error message:

{panel}
There were errors creating an issue in JIRA. Some required fields may not be available on this form. Try creating this issue in JIRA

* customfield_10301: Epic Name is required
* Epic Name is required.
{panel}

With all other issue-types this works perfectly. 
Now we discovered, that the field "Epic Name" is a custom-field from Greenhopper and is mandatory. But with the Jira-Issue-Macro you cannot create Issues with customized mandatory fields. Now, the point is that we have not customized the field "Epic-Name", this comes form the Greenhopper installation. And Greenhopper needs an value in this field to work properly.

The feature to be able to create JIRA-Issues out of Confluence is very important for our business-process and furthermore it would be nice if you can define mandatory fields as you like and they appear in Confluence in the Jira-Issue-Macro-Wizard. 
Are there any workarounds for this bug?

greetings
Benjamin
fields.summary: Error when trying to create an Issue via Jira-Issues-Macro (required fields)
